entry.title: [omnibox][ml] Add feature variation for increased num candidates.
entry.content:
This CL adds a feature variation for ML Scoring w/ increased number

of candidates, so that it can be enabled via chrome://flags.



In this variation, we don't artificially limit the number of candidates

from each provider to a max number (usually 3), but rather pass all to

the controller to score with the ml model.

entry.title: Make HasPopoverAttribute check attribute value
entry.content:
I've been getting feedback about how we don't perfectly match the HTML

spec on some popover things, and one of them was how instead of looking

at the presence of the popover attribute we look at whether our lazily

initialized PopoverData is present or not.



This patch adds a CHECK to HasPopoverAttribute to make sure that the

lazily initialized value matches the presence of PopoverData in order to

make sure that we are actually matching the spec.



Change-Id: I9bc85b11d0981dda5df84cb12149813c4a367c03

entry.content:

called, so the mediator doesn't start observing password store events,

but still waits for them to happen. This causes password check to

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Add mojo piping to get local credentials from NP lib
entry.content:
Adds mojo functionality to fetch the local device's shared credentials

from the NP library. This will be used in a follow up CL to get the

local device's shared credentials and upload them to the server for

daily syncs. See

go/cros-nearby-presence-credential-web-integration



At a high level, the design doc discusses downloading remote devices'

credentials from the Nearby Presence server, and plumbing them to the

Nearby Presence library, which lives in a sandboxed utility process, as

well as retrieving the local device's credentials from the Nearby

Presence library, and uploading them to the Nearby Presence server.

These credentials will be used to authenticate devices that are

advertising nearby. This CL is one part of this: it adds the mojo

piping to retrieve the local device's credentials from the Nearby

Presence library, and in a follow up CL, it will be uploaded to the

Nearby Presence library.



This CL depends on fakes added in cl/541023409



Tested: unit tests only

Bug: b/276307539

Change-Id: Ie9527fef6444e744a55e493fe14c5bf5f3a05865

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4622767

Reviewed-by: Ryan Hansberry

entry.title: [omnibox][cr23] Replace hardcoded colors with tokens.
entry.content:
Updates 3 sets of hardcoded colors:

1) text colors

2) pedal/chip hover and click colors

3) answer icon fg and bg colors



Hardcoded colors were problematic because the hardcoded colors only

respond to dark and light system themes, but not custom-color themes.



Also fixes inkdrop clicks to ripple from the mouse position instead of

the view center. This affects omnibox pedals/chips, but also affects

other views that used `ConfigureInkDropForRefresh2023()`, e.g. the

`chrome` location bar button. This does not fix the issue for all UI

elements; e.g. bookmark bar buttons continue to ripple from the center.



Low-Coverage-Reason: Just renaming a variable and fixing a parameter in location_bar_util.cc - the changes in that file aren't the main concern of this CL.

Bug: 1457362, 1465917

entry.title: FLEDGE: Fix inconsistencies with buyer[AndSeller]ReportingId in adComponents.
entry.content:
We were not accepting those in joinInterestGroup, but would set them in updates; and also the two EstimateSize() implementations would handle their presence differently.



Change it so we don't accept it for updates either (since it doesn't do anything), and also drop any values that end up in the database; this makes the EstimateSize diff immaterial.



Also fixes some tests that were setting buyer_reporting_id while trying to set ad_render_id (did the two changes happen near-simultaneously?)



(Noticed while working on the spec).

entry.title: Revert "[CR2023] Update window shadow and border"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 07d5109a9065c12fec6963fad10a2dcf32512e77.



Reason for revert: This caused multiple regressions.

crbug.com/1466066, crbug.com/1466117, crbug.com/1466085,

crbug.com/1466082



Original change's description:

> [CR2023] Update window shadow and border

>

> * Remove the 1px border from bubbles, dialogs and menus.

> * Update the shadow elevation level 3 according to spec.

> The ambient shadow of this level uses 8px blur and 3px spread, but

> the shadow spread is not supported, so use 12px blur as the closest

> match instead.

> * Update the default shadow elevation to level 3 according to spec.

> * Use views shadows (i.e. BubbleBorder) on macOS whenever possible.

> Before this CL, macOS uses the native shadow which is not

> customizable.

> Sheet dialogs still use the native shadow because the modal black-out

> mask does not cover the shadow area.

> * For menus, make the shadow transparent to mouse events.

> This is a fix of crbug.com/1462791 that is local to menus.

> * Disable event accepting on all platforms for Tab Hover bubble.

> This is to prevent bubble shadows from blocking mouse events.

> See crbug.com/1187189.

>

> screenshot: https://screenshot.googleplex.com/6nj9vEFHcFdsokv

>

> Bug: 1458943, 1462791, 1187189

> Change-Id: I1217c8cb374ebd6fba3330f45d04e533ec031279

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4685088

> Commit-Queue: Keren Zhu

> Code-Coverage: Findit

> Reviewed-by: Allen Bauer

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1171923}



Bug: 1458943, 1462791, 1187189, 1466066, 1466117, 1466085, 1466082

entry.title: [FedCM] Add tests for sec-fetch-{mode, site}
entry.content:
In the process, I found out that we set an incorrect originator --

it should be an opaque origin per the spec:

https://fedidcg.github.io/FedCM/#fetch-config-file



This difference matters because the tests actually connect to the

IDP on the same host, which would lead to a sec-fetch-site value

of `same-site`, when we actually always want it to be `cross-site`.

entry.title: [Tab Group Dialog] Use visibility listener for phones
entry.content:
When hiding the TabGridDialog in the TabSwitcher context on phones it

currently appears as though the stand-in tab bitmap is purged too early.

This leaves an empty space which looks bad at reduced animation speed.

Fix this by copying Tablets and use the VISIBILITY_LISTENER to remove

the bitmap only after the animation is finished.



There is added difficulty in this because the VISIBILITY_LISTENER is

bound to both the TabGroupUi and TabSwitcher versions of the dialog and

there are two separate TabGridDialog{Mediator/Coordinators} and property

models, but only one TabGridDialogView.



Because TabGridDialogView is a singleton, but is controlled by two

separate models there is a significant opportunity for bugs. Unlike the other properties, the correct VISIBILITY_LISTENER is not the same between the two models. To fix this issue a new BINDING_TOKEN property is added which corresponds to the hashCode() of the current

TabGridDialogMediator using the DialogView.



BINDING_TOKEN

* == null - a TabGridDialogMediator may take ownership by setting itself

* new int - a TabGridDialogMediator is taking ownership. It is illegal

state if another TabGridDialogMediator already has ownership. When

installing a new int all the TabGridPanelProperties state is re-bound

using the Model for the mediator taking ownership

(guards were added to cases where this may pose an issue).

* existing int - no-op or process the key that is already there.



Demo at 10x speed reduction:

https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Un13pD2-i4F6UGNwo3Ffexy51z2Cpasy/view?usp=sharing



See bug for the "before" case.



Bug: 1464665

entry.title: DM Api certificate provisioning protocol changes
entry.content:
Adapt the "dynamic" certificate provisioning protocol to the changes

discussed in backend-side design reviews.

This makes the protocol match the API design guidelines

(https://google.aip.dev/) more closely.



The main changes are:

- Transport "no instruction available yet" in the same way as other

unexpected conditions

- Have a response message for each request message for symmetry

- One responsibility per request (`StartOrContinue` has been split

into Start and `GetNextInstruction`, `Upload...` requests don't

deliver the next instruction)



As a consequence, the `CertProvisioningWorkerDynamic` must execute

`Start` first and `GetNextInstruction` afterwards, so the "dynamic

flow" now also uses the `kKeypairGenerated` state.



go/cert-prov-api-dm-changes has been adapted for these changes.

entry.title: [mathml] Draw a radical symbol for empty <mqsrt> elements.
entry.content:
MathML Core says that the element generates an anonymous mrow

called the msqrt base, which is then used for layout [1]. In Blink's

implementation, LayoutNGMathMLBlockWithAnonymousMrow only creates such

an anonymous mrow when a first child is inserted. This CL ensures that

the algo and paint classes handle the case of an empty the same

as if there was an empty .



[1] https://w3c.github.io/mathml-core/#radicals-msqrt-mroot

entry.title: exo: Work around SkRegion size limit
entry.content:
SkRegion forbids 0x7FFFFFFF (INT32_MAX) as width or height, see

SkRegion_kRunTypeSentinel, and would mark the resulting region from the

union in Surface::Damage as empty.



This breaks damage propagation for many Wayland clients as e.g. Mesa uses exactly that value by default if wl_surface_damage_buffer() is not

supported - which is the case in Exo for now.



Thus ensure to limit the damage rect to supported values.



Bug: b:290384406

Change-Id: I45334740a34b196177ea8c3330e5d0f4125edcc4

entry.title: Script: Dynamic imports use their parent base URL as referrer
entry.content:
This CL implements https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/9407, which makes

the request referrer for dynamic import() requests equal to the

referring script's base URL. This already was the case for static

imports, but now we do the same for dynamic imports.



The implementation is more complicated than the spec change because in

the spec, "fetch a single module script" takes in a referrer for use

in fetching, whereas in our implementation, we don't compute the

referrer until later in the process, and by this time we already have

lost access to the `ReferrerScriptInfo` that we have for dynamic

imports. So the way this CL works is that inside

`DynamicModuleResolver::ResolveDynamically()`, we capture the referrer

script's base URL (for use as the referrer in the import

request) — and pass it through as a new optional parameter, simulating the spec's already-existing `referrer` parameter to "fetch a single module script" — to the following methods:



Modulator::FetchTree

ModuleTreeLinkerRegistry::Fetch

ModuleTreeLinker::FetchRoot

* use the new optional `referrer` argument to create the module

script request, as "fetch a single module script" does with its

`referrer` parameter in the spec [1]



[1]: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/webappapis.html#fetching-scripts:fetch-a-single-module-script-4



R=hiroshige@chromium.org



Bug: 1461987

Change-Id: I538a087acfb0113cdf5efa9f69947c605b2c0593

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4678043

Commit-Queue: Dominic Farolino

Reviewed-by: Hiroshige Hayashizaki

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1172405}

entry.title: [ios] Remove NotifyIfActiveWebStateChanged() to make it easier to refactor
entry.content:
Reland the CL with a fix.



In the reverted CL, active_index_ was updated before calling WebStateListDidChange() and it caused the out-of-range error in updateContentOffsetForWebStateIndex:isNewWebState: in TabStripController. The method is called with the value of the current active index (*1) and a TabView is accessed via the active index (*2). A TabView is inserted to the array (*3) at didChangeWebStateList:change:selection:.

The array of TabViews was accessed with the new active index before a new TabView was inserted since active_index_ was updated earlier than the previous implementation, which triggered the out-of-range error.



In this CL, active_index_ is updated after calling WebStateListDidChange() not to change the behavior.



(*1) https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:ios/chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_controller.mm;l=1831;drc=1b9ee37d9e583adb8b4f492115bdb8fd268e8188;bpv=1;bpt=1

(*2) https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:ios/chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_controller.mm;l=1462;drc=1b9ee37d9e583adb8b4f492115bdb8fd268e8188;bpv=1;bpt=1

(*3) https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:ios/chrome/browser/ui/tabs/tab_strip_controller.mm;l=1219-1220;drc=1b9ee37d9e583adb8b4f492115bdb8fd268e8188;bpv=1;bpt=1



This reverts commit 4bc53f9b1ec5c7f2307187d05ab7eca3399df229.



Original change's description:

> Revert "[ios] Remove NotifyIfActiveWebStateChanged() and modify the timing to update active_index_."

>

> This reverts commit eaf4ea0e35dc91718ecf9fd26e9f3c91ecdc0d6c.

>

> Reason for revert: We think this CL is causing AccountsTableTestCase/testSignInPopUpAccountOnSyncSettings to fail https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chrome/builders/ci/ipad-simulator/42289/overview

>

> Original change's description:

> > [ios] Remove NotifyIfActiveWebStateChanged() and modify the timing to update active_index_.

> >

> > This CL

> > - removes NotifyIfActiveWebStateChanged() to make it easier to remove WebStateActivatedAt() API in a follow-up CL.

> > - moves the part to update `active_index_` from *after* calling WebStateListDidChange() to *before* calling it in InsertWebStateImpl() because we want to know the current active index inside WebStateListDidChange().

> >

> > Bug: 1442546

> > Change-Id: Ic30081319023fd8cc3aab093bdfd5abc6e310ded

> > Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4672947

> > Commit-Queue: Asami Doi

entry.title: [ntp] Prevent background image from being set twice on initial NTP load
entry.content:
This is what happens when the NTP is first opened today:



1. new_tab_page_ui.cc sets the background image [1].

2. new_tab_page_handler.cc sets the theme data [2].

3. app.ts sets the background image info [3] via background_manager.ts [4]



The URL in step #1 does not include the scrim display parameter while the URL in step #3 does.

This CL makes it so that the scrim display is set properly in both cases and

background_manager.ts knows that the incoming URL is the same as the image that is

already set [5].



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/new_tab_page/new_tab_page_ui.cc;drc=5788878ec2766e9917dc8f39e822cab9eb66dbd7;l=663

[2]

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/ui/webui/new_tab_page/new_tab_page_handler.cc;drc=75e08319ecff189d180eeab8236a09a4d84f1920;l=467

[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/new_tab_page/app.ts;drc=d1e0e09e0e7eb412492819a346c508f3b13d8265;l=651

[4] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/new_tab_page/background_manager.ts;drc=a23cf0a9c340cee05d40d2e2affa352387e63d51;l=91

[5]

https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/browser/resources/new_tab_page/background_manager.ts;drc=a23cf0a9c340cee05d40d2e2affa352387e63d51;l=116





Change-Id: I0873aca40d14d7707c05c2c12c6df51198e148d2

entry.title: List all inputs to rust targets in GN and verify them during build
entry.content:
RBE requires all inputs to be named in order for it to copy them to

the remote build environment.



GN analyze requires all inputs to be named in order to decide what

needs to be rebuilt based on a list of modified files. The current GN

analyze setup was supposed to do this as well, but it is not working.



Have gnrt produce a list of all (possible) input files for 3p and

stdlib crates so that it can be included in the generated BUILD.gn

files.



Then verify in rustc_wrapper.py that all inputs rustc reports are

found in the GN rule's sources or inputs fields by comparing with the

depfile produced from rustc.



Bug: 1459444

Change-Id: I74ce3bfa9a6404be3d3493c1bd6fc0f790809667

entry.title: Modernize Autofill FormData and FormFieldData test functions.
entry.content:
This CL is a mechnical change that primarily does two things:

1) It replaces const char* arguments by std::string_view

to also allow passing std::string.

2) For every existing function, it adds a sibling without

an out parameter that instead returns by value.



Lastly, the CL removes a couple of unused (default-set)

parameters. The CL does not (yet) replace any actual use of the old

out-parameter functions.



Low-Coverage-Reason: The concerned code is testing infrastructure.

entry.title: Add and apply CookieInclusionStatus::WARN_THIRD_PARTY_PHASEOUT reason
entry.content:
This warning reason should be added when getting/setting cookies meets

the following conditions:

1. “Block third-party cookies” toggle is off (i.e. 3p cookies are

allowed)

2. cookie is accessed in a 3p context

3. cookie is SameSite=None;Secure and not partitioned

4. the access is not allowed by explicit settings

entry.title: Navigation: non-traditional about:srcdoc WPTs
entry.content:
This CL adds WPTs for some observable behavior (request referrer string

resolution) defined for "about:srcdoc" documents, and ensures that the

behavior is consistent between normal srcdoc documents and what I'm

calling nontraditional srdoc documents, which are those created via:

1. `document.open()`

2. `javascript:` URL navigations





Additionally, this CL tests the scenario where we run:



`history.replaceState(null, '', 'about:srcdoc#foo')`



... inside the about:srcdoc iframe to give it the above URL. We then

re-run the referrer resolution test to ensure the

`about:srcdoc#foo` is treated as a normal `about:srcdoc` iframe.



Chromium fails that last part due to a bug in

`blink::CanChangeToUrlForHistoryApi` causing the implementation to

deviate from the spec; see https://crbug.com/1465972.



See https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/9514.



R=domenic@chromium.org



Bug: 1465972

Change-Id: I62939511995f929f0ad4ce8c121172b1194e2b2e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4690242

entry.title: [Viewport Segments API] Add Windows support for foldable PCs.
entry.content:
This patch enable Windows support for the Viewport Segments API on Windows

for foldables PCs (foldable OLED screen).

Due to lack of native API in Windows, the ecosystem gathered around the

following approach to inform the segments of the device :

https://github.com/foldable-devices/foldable-windows-registry-specification



When/If Windows receive a proper native API we will remove this approach

in favor of the official one.



Bug: 1039050

Change-Id: I3d949fbca5842758cd9c197fdf02c7d5838766ea

entry.title: Chrome App windows: Respect OTR WindowOpenDisposition
entry.content:
Chrome App windows force the opening of links in new windows to be done

in a new tab instead. This did not consider whether OFF_THE_RECORD

(incognito) was specified, so a link a user intended to open in an

incognito window would be opened in a non-incognito window.



We now no longer force the WindowOpenDisposition in this case.



Bug: 1464784

entry.title: [CDP] Check drag start mouse move is handled
entry.content:
It's possible that the mouse movement that starts a drag is acked

after dragging starts. When this happens,



1. `StartDragging` will update the drag state with the mouse

movement (through `last_mouse_move_`), then

2. the mouse movement (this time from acking in `OnInputEventAck`)

will attempt to update the drag state _again_.



Since we only want the mouse movement to update the drag state once,

we attempt to stop it here.



Since we don't have unique identifiers for each event, the best we

can hope for is the timestamps are the same.



Note that in general, the mouse movement will be acked before the

dragging starts, so this should happen rarely.



Bug: 1430420

Change-Id: I4f8919064878e1b6685f59abf0bfc1729d1ff724

Fixed: 1459188

entry.title: SmartCard: Add timeout parameter to getStatusChange()
entry.content:
The timeout parameter of SCardGetStatusChange() and SCardCancel() usage

are not equivalent in terms of resulting behavior. This creates room

for behavioural differences and bugs when moving PC/SC C code to be run

on top of the Web API.



Tere's code that pases a timeout of zero for instance, along with

"unaware" reader states.



When SCardCancel is called very close to a SCardGetStatusChange, there's

no guarantee it will work and it depends on the PC/SC implementation.

Even if the SCardGetStatusChange is processed before the SCardCancel,

the service might still be setting up some internal state for

SCardGetStatusChange and therefore that cancel might not work at that

early moment.



Thus a getStatusChange() with a very short AbortSignal.timeout(ms) (eg:

a couple of milliseconds) would most likely not get cancelled at all.



Bug: 1464611

Change-Id: I76cdd1b695331dc062c17e5d3c74892eedf84b82

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4687268

entry.title: Close connection when receiving HTTP/2 server push.
entry.content:
Chromium sends SETTINGS_ENABLE_PUSH = 0 in the initial SETTINGS frame

[1], therefore receiving a PUSH_PROMISE MUST be treated as a connection

error [2].



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/main:net/http/http_network_session.cc;l=56-57;drc=255b4e7036f1326f2219bd547d3d6dcf76064870

entry.title: [iOS] Add EGTests for Reading List when re-sign-in with the promo
entry.content:
Adds EGTests for the case the user re-sign-in with the Reading List

promo, checking that:

- the signed-in identity is correct if another account is used for the second sign-in;

- if a items is removed before sign-out, it does not appear after

re-sign-in with the same account;

- if an item is marked as read, it remains read after re-sign-in with

the same account.



Due to the bug of multiple refresh after an item is moved, it's needed

to add a delay after the item is moved before checking the UI

components, which could be hopefully removed once crbug.com/1445875 will

be fixed.

entry.title: Revert "mediapipe: add include and update visibility"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 47515dddcc8f09e62d1b169d1ae74de36a910009.



Reason for revert: It looks possible for Chromium to depend on

MediaPipe (https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:third_party/mediapipe/features.gni;l=6-8;drc=6f557d86c8a3fe458b27ba90f3234d3fbab42983) hence this CL can cause ODR violations and macros clashes (CHECK is

alrady defined by Chromium).



Original change's description:

> mediapipe: add include and update visibility

>

> registration.h uses macros such as CHECK_*, so it needs to

> include absl's check. Without this errors such as the following are

> generated:

>

> In file included from ../../third_party/mediapipe/src/mediapipe/framework/api2/node.h:8:

> In file included from ../../third_party/mediapipe/src/mediapipe/framework/api2/contract.h:10:

> In file included from ../../third_party/mediapipe/src/mediapipe/framework/api2/packet.h:18:

> In file included from ../../third_party/mediapipe/src/mediapipe/framework/packet.h:30:

> ../../third_party/mediapipe/src/mediapipe/framework/deps/registration.h:274:7: error: use of undeclared identifier 'CHECK_EQ'

> 274 | CHECK_EQ(1u, names.size())

>

> This also adds absl's log/check to a bunch of places that needed.

>

> Bug: None

> Change-Id: I7c0b19614ab4c1b3ab25c173390c8c2234b28bb1

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4697420

> Reviewed-by: Rick Byers

> Commit-Queue: Scott Violet

> Reviewed-by: Robert Ogden

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1171991}



Bug: None

entry.title: Implement manual fallback explicit triggering metric.
entry.content:
Implements the ExplicitTriggering metric, as defined in the metrics

design doc [1].



Since in M1 only address fallbacks exist, the metric

doesn't distinguish between form types. The metric name still contains

the ".Address" though, so it can later be easily parameterized.

Similarly, since unclassified fields are not considered in M1,

the AutocompleteState doesn't include an UnclassifiedField option for

now.



The metric is emitted when the context menu gets closed, by relying on

RenderViewContextMenuObserver::OnMenuClosed().



[1] https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Lb346eaee6GfQ6iDbPH44hz_VwyPcpj9Pj-2O2TK9vE/edit?resourcekey=0-hW0oTZZhhiGLiQEu81ptfA

entry.title: [iOS] Fix flaky UKMTestCase tests
entry.content:
This re-enables testConsentAddedButNoSync and testHistoryDelete.



These tests were previously flaking because they enable Sync through

Recent Tabs, and when the list of recent tabs is too long, the

animation of the button underneath the view is offscreen, which

prevents the app from becoming idle from Earl Grey's perspective

(similar issues have been seen before in crbug.com/640977).



This CL fixes the flake by clearing browsing history during `setUp`,

so that the list of recent tabs is empty.

entry.title: Distinguish new users skipping profile migration.
entry.content:
To enable Lacros, users have to complete profile migration and have it

marked as completed. For new users who are added when Lacros is already

enabled, profile migration is marked as completed due to there not being

any data that has to be migrated.



Currently there is no way to distinguish these users from users who've

gone from Ash to Lacros while undergoing profile migration. This can

make debugging harder from user reports.



This patch makes it possible to distinguish the two groups by

introducing `MigrationMode::kSkipForNewUser`.



Note that the introduction of this mode changes the meaning of

`MigrationMode`, which previously corresponded to the type of

`MigratiorDelegate`, to something that is used primarily to mark what

type of migration was completed.



In subsequent patches, the remaining use of `MigrationMode` in the old

way, e.g. passing mode to `BrowserDataMigrator::Migrate()` will be

removed. This is part of an effort to remove copy migrator.



Bug: 1464442

Test: tast run $DUT lacros.MigrateBasic, unit_tests, browser_tests

Change-Id: I980c9661d91b7909d1312aa38e745cf86a9244ca

entry.title: Make AutofillContextMenuManager a RenderViewContextMenuObserver.
entry.content:
Currently, the RenderViewContextMenu implementation manually calls the

AutofillContextMenuManager in a lot of places. By implementing

RenderViewContextMenuObserver, this can be simplified.



This will allow follow-up CLs to rely on the OnMenuClosed() callback to

collect metrics.

entry.title: dlp: Add FilesPolicyDialog block browser tests
entry.content:
- Adds browser tests for creating FilesPolicyErrorDialog-s without or

with a modal parent.

- Moves tests for the "old" dialog UI (that we still use) from FPNM to

the dialog test. After some changes in FPNM, the tests there were not

even creating a dialog anymore, but showing a notification. These

test focus on checking that creating the dialog doesn't crash with

some specific actions or destination.

entry.title: Do not keep a member variable to the PWM driver factory around.
entry.content:
The driver factory's lifetime is strictly smaller than that of

ChromeAutofillClient. This CL therefore replaces the raw pointer to

the driver factory and gets it when needed.

entry.title: Lookalikes: Add script to fetch CrUX domains
entry.content:
Going forward, we'll use the Chrome UX Report domain list

(https://developer.chrome.com/docs/crux/) as the

lookalike top domain list. This CL adds a script to fetch domains from

this list and write them in a suitable format.

entry.title: Reenable a manual password generation test
entry.content:
PasswordGenerationIntegrationTest.testManualGenerationUsePassword was

disabled because it was flaky. In the meantime the layout of

keyboard accessory changed so toggleAccessorySheet method needed to be

updated. To fix the flakiness it was necessary to wait until all the

UI elements have been inflated (the view holder and the buttons inside).
